Dear Brian Philson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Kari Muntean, the area manager at (734) 395-0920.

Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158-2 Discipline
Section
Description
Violation Rule Violation
Type
Allegation I received a message from Highfields indicating a staff member
threatened a youth. The staff has been terminated. I did not get any
other details.
Investigation Complainant was emailed about further information on 1/10/2023.
She responded with the Chief Administrator’s phone number and
identifying him as being the individual who left her a voice message
about the incident.
Administrator was interviewed via telephone, on 1/10/2023. He
reported calling Complainant with the information. He also reported
2

firing Staff 1, “the minute” he found out about the incident. Youth A is
still in the program on campus.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
1/11/2023. He reported understanding that the incident took place
“towards the end of the night” on 1/6/2023. When Staff 1 informed
Youth A that she would have to check with the supervisor before
allowing him permission to call his mother, Youth A asked again to
speak to his mother. Youth A then told Staff 1 if she did not allow him to
speak to his mother right now, he would punch Youth B in the face.
Youth B and Staff 1 were engaged in a conversation at that time. Youth
A then punched Youth B causing staff to engage in separating the
youth. A short time later, Youth A and Staff 1 began a verbal
confrontation resulting in Youth A cursing at Staff 1. Staff 1 was
reported to respond with something like “I will have someone come up
here and take care of you”. Supervisor and Staff 2 were present and
witnessed the interaction. Supervisor called Administrator and
Administrator told him to “remove her from the house”. Administrator
reported Staff 1 did not work the next day and when coming into work
on Monday, he met with her and Supervisor to discuss the situation. It
was at this time Administrator “let her go” as an employee. He also
reported she had no further contact with any youth after leaving work
on Friday.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
1/11/2023. He reported Youth A and Youth B had gotten into a fight and
when he arrived on the scene, staff had the youth separated. He went
into the office to secure another staff for the shift and when leaving the
office, he witnessed Youth A and Staff 1 engaged in a verbal
confrontation. “Youth A was blowing up and Staff 1 was screaming at
him.” He also reported Staff 1 was upset and said, “I’m going to get my
brother to come out here and he will kill you”. Staff 2 was present and
pulled Staff 1 away from Youth A. Supervisor also reported calling
Administrator about the situation, and he confirmed Administrator told
him to keep Staff 1 away from Youth A. Staff 1 took a “cool down time”
and went to the gym with Youth B after this. He reported this all took
place at the end of the shift, around 10:40 pm with the shift ending at
11:00 pm.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 1/11/2023.
He reported remembering the incident and how he was deescalating
when Staff 1 began to yell at him. He was cursing at Staff 1 and Staff 1
kept screaming louder at him. He stated, “Staff 1 said her brother would
come up and put me six feet under. Someone will come up here and kill
you.” He also reported Staff 1 had to be stopped by other staff because
4

she was “coming after me physically”. He is now talking to his therapist
about his fear of Staff 1’s brother coming to harm him.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 1/11/2023.
He reported talking with Staff 1 when Youth A came up and punched
him “out of the blue”. He also reported knowing nothing else about the
situation and was removed from the house for a while after being hit.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 1/11/2023.
She reported being present during the situation between Youth A and
Staff 1 and when Youth A punched Youth B. She stated following the
fight, “Staff 1 said she was going to have her brother come up here”.
She also reported not being sure of the reasons for the argument nor
why Staff 1 was involving her brother. She denied any physical
aggression by Staff 1 but did believe Staff 1 was not using de-
escalation techniques as trained. Staff 2 viewed Staff 1 as acting
inappropriately in dealing with Youth A before being removed and
“taken outside to calm down”.
JJ Case Worker was interviewed on the phone, on 1/11/2023. She
reported being made aware of the incident on 1/9/2023 by the facility.
She also reported having no concerns about the program and is
speaking with Youth A weekly. She believes he is getting his weekly
therapy and he has a habit of “complaining about everything he can”.
Staff 1 was interviewed on the phone, on 1/17/2023. She reported
being terminated from her employment at the facility on 1/9/2023
because she had a “heated argument with Youth A”. She was unable to
recall specifically what she said but admitted she said something
inappropriate to make herself feel better. She also reported she had let
her anger get the best of her in the “heat of the moment”.
Documents Reviewed:
Staff 1’s HR file was reviewed. She is current on her training as
required. Other documents within this file included:
• Verbal Reprimand email dated 12/6/2022. This reprimand was the
result of a youth reporting Staff 1 had made unneeded comments and
was antagonistic towards him. She admitted to these claims. She was
informed of disciplinary action if similar behavior occurred in the future.
• Performance review dated 1/22/2022 was reviewed. This covered a
time of 1/22/2021 to 1/22/2022 and was documented as an” annual”
review. “Teamwork and communication” are documented as “needing
improvement”. Her goals consisted of the development of self-
4

awareness and being more mindful of body language and verbal
presentation when interacting with Youth under high stress.
• Termination letter dated 1/9/2023. This letter was in the file and
documented her employment was terminated on 1/9/2023. The reasons
for the terminated are noted as, “An altercation with Youth A on
1/6/2023”. Her behavior is documented as resulting in a “type A
misconduct”. The other reason for her termination involves an
altercation between herself and other youth during December 2022.
Discipline policy/procedures without a date. This document outlines
“unacceptable consequences” with working with the youth in care.
Verbal abuse is listed as one of the unacceptable consequences.
Updated Residential Treatment Plan with a report period of 7/26/22
to 10/21/22. This document outlines the treatment goals for Youth A
and these goals address the presenting problems identified. His
progress/lack of progress is documented as are the objects and staff's
intervention in helping him achieve his goals.
Video Recording dated 1/6/23 at 10:26 pm. The video recording is of
the common area in the house where Youth A is lodged. In the opening
scene Youth A, is walking around the room next to Staff 2 and he is
using significant arm gestures suggesting he is upset. Staff 1 is
standing in a doorway. Approximately 30 seconds later, Staff 1 leaves
the doorway and walks towards Youth A and Staff 2. Staff 1 appears to
be making numerous gestures with her arms suggests being upset
before Staff 2 stands between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 2 pushes Staff
1 out of the room and Staff 1 continues with her arm/hand gestures
towards Youth A. Staff 1 exits the scene 10 seconds later.
Analysis Based upon interviews and video recording, there is evidence to
support Staff 1 engaged in verbally abusive language and gestures
when interacting with Youth A on 1/6/2023.
It should be noted, the facility took appropriate action with Staff 1 once
Administrator was made aware of her behaviors. She was separated
from Youth A and had no further contact with any of the youth after the
end of her shift the day of the incident. There is no technical assistance
or consultation because the facility is self-reporting in an effort to stay in
compliance with licensing rules.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the that the current license status be continued.
